page.title: 09STORTFORD 1910-1985
page.content: CHERYL PARKER looks at the changes in Bishops Stortford, 1910 - 1985. In my colour picture of 1910, the Causeway is just mud and so is the pathway. Tall trees grow over the road; the river flows untamed and over-grown,a brick bridge leads to the castle ruins. There is no traffic; all is peaceful. A girl in black stockings, a pale blue pinafore and a straw hat stops to chat to an old man in rag-like clothes. Seventy five years later all is changed. Hoards of vehicles roar down the road, hundreds of people hurry by in normal and outrageous clothes. The river is tamed, the trees are cleared away. The bridge is graffiti-sprayed concrete. Everyone is rushed and everything is noisy.
